name: Apple scab
description: Apple scab is a fungal disease caused by Venturia inaequalis, leading to dark, scabby lesions on leaves, fruit, and twigs.
cure: Use fungicides such as captan, sulfur, or myclobutanil. Implement proper sanitation practices by removing fallen leaves and pruning infected twigs.

name: Apple black rot
description: Black rot of apple is caused by the fungus Botryosphaeria obtusa, leading to rotted fruit, leaf spots, and cankers on branches.
cure: Prune out and destroy infected branches. Apply fungicides like captan or myclobutanil. Maintain tree health with proper fertilization and watering.

name: Apple cedar apple rust
description: Cedar apple rust is caused by the fungus Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae, resulting in yellow-orange spots on leaves and fruit.
cure: Remove nearby cedar trees if possible. Apply fungicides like myclobutanil or sulfur during the growing season.

name: Apple healthy
description: A healthy apple tree shows no signs of disease or pests, producing healthy leaves, flowers, and fruit.
cure: Maintain proper watering, fertilization, and pruning. Monitor regularly for pests and diseases.

name: Blueberry healthy
description: A healthy blueberry plant has vibrant green leaves, strong stems, and produces an abundance of fruit without disease symptoms.
cure: Provide adequate water, mulch to conserve moisture, and use fertilizers appropriate for blueberries. Monitor for pests and diseases.

name: Cherry including sour powdery mildew
description: Powdery mildew on cherry is caused by Podosphaera clandestina, leading to white, powdery growth on leaves and fruit.
cure: Apply fungicides like sulfur or myclobutanil. Improve air circulation through proper spacing and pruning.

name: Cherry including sour healthy
description: A healthy cherry tree shows no signs of disease or pests and produces healthy leaves, flowers, and fruit.
cure: Regularly water, fertilize, and prune cherry trees. Monitor for pests and diseases.

name: Corn maize cercospora leaf spot gray leaf spot
description: Gray leaf spot is caused by Cercospora zeae-maydis, resulting in rectangular lesions on leaves that can reduce photosynthesis.
cure: Rotate crops and use resistant hybrids. Apply fungicides like strobilurins or triazoles if necessary.

name: Corn maize common rust
description: Common rust in corn is caused by Puccinia sorghi, leading to reddish-brown pustules on leaves.
cure: Plant resistant varieties. Apply fungicides if severe, particularly during tasseling and silking.

name: Corn maize northern leaf blight
description: Northern leaf blight is caused by Exserohilum turcicum, resulting in long, elliptical lesions on leaves.
cure: Use resistant hybrids and practice crop rotation. Apply fungicides if needed.

name: Corn maize healthy
description: A healthy corn plant has robust green leaves, strong stalks, and produces ample ears of corn without disease symptoms.
cure: Ensure proper watering, fertilization, and pest monitoring. Use resistant varieties and rotate crops.

name: Grape black rot
description: Black rot of grape is caused by the fungus Guignardia bidwellii, leading to black lesions on leaves, stems, and fruit.
cure: Apply fungicides like mancozeb or myclobutanil. Remove and destroy infected plant parts.

name: Grape esca black measles
description: Esca, also known as black measles, is a complex disease caused by several fungal pathogens, leading to leaf striping and fruit rot.
cure: Prune and destroy infected wood. Use fungicides like thiophanate-methyl and ensure proper vineyard sanitation.

name: Grape leaf blight isariopsis leaf spot
description: Isariopsis leaf spot, caused by the fungus Isariopsis clavispora, leads to dark spots on grape leaves.
cure: Apply fungicides like copper-based products. Remove and destroy infected leaves.

name: Grape healthy
description: A healthy grapevine produces lush green leaves, vigorous growth, and plentiful fruit without disease symptoms.
cure: Maintain proper watering, fertilization, and pruning practices. Monitor for pests and diseases.

name: Orange haunglongbing citrus greening
description: Citrus greening, or Huanglongbing, is a bacterial disease caused by Candidatus Liberibacter species, leading to yellow shoots and bitter, misshapen fruit.
cure: There is no cure, but management includes removing infected trees, controlling psyllid vectors, and applying foliar nutrients.

name: Peach bacterial spot
description: Bacterial spot of peach is caused by Xanthomonas arboricola pv. pruni, leading to spots on leaves and fruit and defoliation.
cure: Apply copper-based bactericides. Use resistant varieties and practice proper sanitation.

name: Peach healthy
description: A healthy peach tree shows no signs of disease or pests and produces healthy leaves, flowers, and fruit.
cure: Provide regular watering, fertilization, and pruning. Monitor for pests and diseases.

name: Pepper bell bacterial spot
description: Bacterial spot in bell pepper is caused by Xanthomonas campestris pv. vesicatoria, leading to water-soaked spots on leaves and fruit.
cure: Use resistant varieties and apply copper-based bactericides. Practice crop rotation and proper sanitation.

name: Pepper bell healthy
description: A healthy bell pepper plant has vibrant green leaves, strong stems, and produces healthy peppers without disease symptoms.
cure: Ensure proper watering, fertilization, and pest monitoring. Use resistant varieties and rotate crops.

name: Potato early blight
description: Early blight in potato is caused by Alternaria solani, resulting in concentric ring lesions on leaves and tubers.
cure: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or mancozeb. Practice crop rotation and remove plant debris.

name: Potato late blight
description: Late blight in potato is caused by Phytophthora infestans, leading to water-soaked lesions on leaves and tubers.
cure: Use resistant varieties and apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or copper-based products. Ensure proper field drainage.

name: Potato healthy
description: A healthy potato plant has robust green leaves and produces healthy tubers without disease symptoms.
cure: Maintain proper watering, fertilization, and pest monitoring. Use resistant varieties and rotate crops.

name: Raspberry healthy
description: A healthy raspberry plant has lush green leaves, strong canes, and produces abundant fruit without disease symptoms.
cure: Provide adequate water, mulch to conserve moisture, and use fertilizers appropriate for raspberries. Monitor for pests and diseases.

name: Soybean healthy
description: A healthy soybean plant has vigorous growth with green leaves and produces ample pods without disease symptoms.
cure: Ensure proper watering, fertilization, and pest monitoring. Use resistant varieties and rotate crops.

name: Squash powdery mildew
description: Powdery mildew on squash is caused by Podosphaera xanthii, leading to white, powdery growth on leaves.
cure: Apply fungicides like sulfur or potassium bicarbonate. Improve air circulation and reduce humidity.

name: Strawberry leaf scorch
description: Leaf scorch in strawberries is caused by Diplocarpon earlianum, leading to purple spots on leaves that turn into large dead areas.
cure: Remove and destroy infected leaves. Apply fungicides like myclobutanil or captan.

name: Strawberry healthy
description: A healthy strawberry plant has vibrant green leaves and produces abundant, disease-free fruit.
cure: Ensure proper watering, fertilization, and pest monitoring. Use resistant varieties and practice crop rotation.

name: Tomato bacterial spot
description: Bacterial spot on tomato is caused by Xanthomonas spp., leading to water-soaked spots on leaves and fruit.
cure: Apply copper-based bactericides. Use resistant varieties and practice proper sanitation.

name: Tomato early blight
description: Early blight in tomato is caused by Alternaria solani, resulting in concentric ring lesions on leaves and fruit.
cure: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or mancozeb. Practice crop rotation and remove plant debris.

name: Tomato late blight
description: Late blight in tomato is caused by Phytophthora infestans, leading to water-soaked lesions on leaves and fruit.
cure: Use resistant varieties and apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or copper-based products. Ensure proper field drainage.

name: Tomato leaf mold
description: Leaf mold in tomato is caused by Passalora fulva, resulting in yellow spots on upper leaf surfaces and mold on the undersides.
cure: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or copper-based products. Improve air circulation and reduce humidity.

name: Tomato septoria leaf spot
description: Septoria leaf spot in tomato is caused by Septoria lycopersici, leading to small, circular spots with dark borders on leaves.
cure: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or mancozeb. Remove and destroy infected leaves.

name: Tomato spider mites two spotted spider mite
description: Two-spotted spider mites on tomato cause stippling and bronzing of leaves, leading to defoliation.
cure: Use miticides like abamectin or horticultural oils. Maintain proper watering to reduce plant stress.

name: Tomato target spot
description: Target spot in tomato is caused by Corynespora cassiicola, leading to dark, concentric ring lesions on leaves and fruit.
cure: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or mancozeb. Practice crop rotation and remove plant debris.

name: Tomato yellow leaf curl virus
description: Yellow leaf curl virus in tomato is spread by whiteflies, causing yellowing and curling of leaves and stunted growth.
cure: Control whitefly populations using insecticides or biological control. Use resistant varieties and practice good sanitation.

name: Tomato mosaic virus
description: Tomato mosaic virus causes mottling and distortion of leaves and reduced fruit quality.
cure: There is no cure, but management includes using resistant varieties, practicing crop rotation, and maintaining good sanitation.

name: Tomato healthy
description: A healthy tomato plant has robust green leaves, strong stems, and produces healthy tomatoes without disease symptoms.
cure: Ensure proper watering, fertilization, and pest monitoring. Use resistant varieties and practice crop rotation.
